docs.snippet: Responsive to an extensively advertised and numerously signed call, Cooper Institute was crowded with a highly respectable audience last evening Among the distinguished citizens present, and serving as officers, were Hon. George Bancroft, Rev....

headline.main: AN EMANCIPATION MEETING.; Cooper Institute Crowded---A Son of Alexander Hamilton in the Chair. Speeches by Carl Schurz and Rev. Mr. Conway. Letters from Senators Summer, Wilson and Wilmot, and Rev. John Pierpont. SPEECH OF MR. CONWAY. SPEECH OF HON. CARL SCHURZ.

docs.lead_paragraph: Responsive to an extensively advertised and numerously signed call, Cooper Institute was crowded with a highly respectable audience last evening Among the distinguished citizens present, and serving as officers, were Hon. George Bancroft, Rev. DrTyng, Rev. Wm. Hague, Prof. Lieber, Gerrit Smith, ...

docs.snippet: A correspondent of the Richmond Dispatch. writing from Camp Mason, near Winchester, says the troops in that direction are improving in health, and but little sickness exist. A portion have received marching orders, but to what point is not known.
docs.lead_paragraph: A correspondent of the Richmond Dispatch. writing from Camp Mason, near Winchester, says the troops in that direction are improving in health, and but little sickness exist. A portion have received marching orders, but to what point is not known.

docs.snippet: The outgoing mail will carry startling news to our friends from this hitherto quiet and flourishing place. Ningpo has at last fallen under Tai-Ping rule, the cruel despotism of which is being keenly felt not only by the few inhabitants left within...

headline.main: THE CHINESE REBELLION.; Advance of the Rebel Hordes Toward Ningpo The War, its Incidents and Prospects.

docs.lead_paragraph: The outgoing mail will carry startling news to our friends from this hitherto quiet and flourishing place. Ningpo has at last fallen under Tai-Ping rule, the cruel despotism of which is being keenly felt not only by the few inhabitants left within the walls, but also by the whole surrounding country.

docs.snippet: The gunboat Saxon, from Ship Island Feb. 22, arrived here this morning. Capt. SNOW reports seeing a vessel, supported to be the gunboat Kensington, which towed out the ship-of-the-line Vermont, on Sunday last, at 3 o'clock, off Cape Hatteras.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM SHIP ISLAND.; Capture of the Rebel Steamer Magnolia, with Four Hundred Bales of Cotton--A Dozen Oyster Boats Seized, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The gunboat Saxon, from Ship Island Feb. 22, arrived here this morning. Capt. SNOW reports seeing a vessel, supported to be the gunboat Kensington, which towed out the ship-of-the-line Vermont, on Sunday last, at 3 o'clock, off Cape Hatteras.

docs.snippet: The news from the interior continues to be favorable to MOSQUERA. The British steamor Saladin brings only two days later from Bogata to the 27th January but she announces the fact that's battle was fought near Cucuta, is the State of Santander, ...

headline.main: UNITED STATES OF COLOMBIA.; Victory of Mosquera over Canal in Santander, and over Arboleda to Cauca-Loss of the American Steamer John Hart--Maracaibo declared for union with Colombia--Naval Items, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The news from the interior continues to be favorable to MOSQUERA. The British steamor Saladin brings only two days later from Bogata to the 27th January but she announces the fact that's battle was fought near Cucuta, is the State of Santander, ...

docs.snippet: Mr. BUFFINTON, of Massachusetts, (Rep.,) inreduced a bill authorizing the appointment of two Deputy Inspector Generals. Referred to the Committee on Military Affars.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. BUFFINTON, of Massachusetts, (Rep.,) inreduced a bill authorizing the appointment of two Deputy Inspector Generals. Referred to the Committee on Military Affars.

docs.snippet: President LINCOLN yesterday transmitted a message to Congress, recommending the adoption of a joint resolution, to the effect that the Government will cooperate with any State which may adopt a gradual abolishment of Slavery, giving to such State...
docs.lead_paragraph: President LINCOLN yesterday transmitted a message to Congress, recommending the adoption of a joint resolution, to the effect that the Government will cooperate with any State which may adopt a gradual abolishment of Slavery, giving to such State pecuniary aid.

docs.snippet: The steamship Northern Light, from Aspinwall on the 25th ult., with the passengers and treasure which left San Francisco on the 15th, arrived at this port yesterday morning. The treasure-list foots up $679,071.
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Northern Light, from Aspinwall on the 25th ult., with the passengers and treasure which left San Francisco on the 15th, arrived at this port yesterday morning. The treasure-list foots up $679,071.

docs.snippet: At the Chamber of Commerce meeting, yesterday afternoon, the President, P. PERIT, Esq., in the chair, the following new members were unanimously elected:

headline.main: Chamber of Commerce.; NEW MEMBERS--INDORSEMENT OF THE HEALTH BILL--QUARANTINE MATTERS--MOVEMENT TO ABOLISH THE USURY LAWS--A STATE ASSESSOR WANTED FROM THE CITY--COMPLIMENTS TO JOHN BRIGHT.
